Text: Japan Working Group Conference Call Cc to the conference call which is to be held on Friday February Sydney time Following are the details of the ATT conference call for your attention Host name Nicholas ODay Confirmation Number Conference time Houston February London February Tokyo February Poland February Chile February Calling from USA Outside USA Dial ATT access number then ATT access numbers London Japan Poland Chile For those who will not be in any of the above countries at the time of the call I have attached the ATT Number Finder so that you can look up the required ATT number To install this application double click on the icon and follow the instructions on your screen Hopefully I will get an agenda to you some time today Please let me know if you have any queries If you will not be able to participate in the conference call please let me know Regards Shari Wicks Secretary to Nick ODay

Japan Working Group Conference Call Cc a draft agenda for the first meeting of the Japan Working Group I will endeavour to phone each of you prior to the meeting to discuss your thoughts on the Working Group including what you want out of your participation in the Group I will be in E Powers office in Tokyo this week if you would like to contact me I look forward to speaking with you and to the meeting later this week Nick ODay

Japan Working Group Conference Call Cc nicholasoODay is proposing to hold the next Japan Working Group Conference Call on Tuesday April at am Houston time Nick will be visiting Houston over the period April to April and would like to hold the call during this period Please let me know if you will not be available for this call

Japan Working Group Conference Call Cc nicholaso conference call for the Japan Working Group is scheduled for am Houston time pm London time on Tuesday April The location of the meeting in Houston office is ACC The call in details are Host name Nicholas ODay Enron Confirmation No Dial in numbers USA Outside USA Dial ATT access number then London ATT access number Please find attached below minutes and agenda for your attention

Brokerage Agreement with ABN Amro Cc I have checked our files We do not have an agreement with ABN Amro I have also spoken to David Minns and he confirms this David has discussed this with Sara Ta Shari

Brokerage Agreement with ABN Amro Cc I have checked our files We do not have an agreement with ABN Amro I have also spoken to David Minns and he confirms this David has discussed this with Sara Ta Shari

Cc David Thank you for your email Enclosed is a copy of the latest set of our General Terms and Conditions Following are the comments on the points which you raised Calculation Period We have used the term Calculation Period as that is a term which is used in the Australian electricity market Although it is common practice for the Calculation Period to be defined in confirmations by reference to an attached schedule we have also included a definition in paragraph h of the attached General Terms and Conditions Electricity Financial Australia Notional Quantity per Contract Period In the electricity market in Australia it is standard practice to refer to the Notional Quantity per Calculation Period in megawatt hours Hence for consistency we would prefer to use that term We recognise under Section of the Commodity Definitions the terms Notional Quantity and Notional Quantity per Calculation Period are interchangeable Index We prefer to use the current definition of the Index because it directly tracts the wording used to describe a spot price in Australian Addendum No to the ISDA Master Agreement which covers electricity transactions You will note for this addendum is incorporated into the GTCs pursuant to paragraph g Enclosed are the latest versions of the long form product definitions for swaps They cover three load shapes being peak off peak and flat Regards David Minns

Cc David Thank you for your email Enclosed is a copy of the latest set of our General Terms and Conditions Following are the comments on the points which you raised Calculation Period We have used the term Calculation Period as that is a term which is used in the Australian electricity market Although it is common practice for the Calculation Period to be defined in confirmations by reference to an attached schedule we have also included a definition in paragraph h of the attached General Terms and Conditions Electricity Financial Australia Notional Quantity per Contract Period In the electricity market in Australia it is standard practice to refer to the Notional Quantity per Calculation Period in megawatt hours Hence for consistency we would prefer to use that term We recognise under Section of the Commodity Definitions the terms Notional Quantity and Notional Quantity per Calculation Period are interchangeable Index We prefer to use the current definition of the Index because it directly tracts the wording used to describe a spot price in Australian Addendum No to the ISDA Master Agreement which covers electricity transactions You will note for this addendum is incorporated into the GTCs pursuant to paragraph g Enclosed are the latest versions of the long form product definitions for swaps They cover three load shapes being peak off peak and flat Regards David Minns
